intro: Stachys setifera subsp. iranica, commonly known as the Iranian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are small, clustered in whorls, and often have a purple or violet hue. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to temperate to cold climates.
